commentary.line: That's all we have for you from this game. However, the IPL goes on as we have a double-header coming your way tomorrow. First up, MUM take on HYD at Wankhede and then we have CHN locking horns with PUN at Chepauk. Join us for those two games. Until then, take care and Cya!
Let's have a look at some of the best tweets from this game
Sid Mallya: Yeeeeeeesssssss!!!!! Exactly what was needed to get our season back on track!! Awesome win! #BLR #RAJvBLR #IPL
Aakash Chopra: #BLR's weaker link won them this game...restricting #RAJ for 130 was commendable. 2 losses in a row after 5 wins. Wake up call for #RAJ. #IPL
Ayaz Memon: Facile but very important win for Bangalore. Also signals perhaps a turnaround in the league. Now for Mumbai to come good tomorrow!
Yohan Blake: Good win @BLRTweets we needed that
Mohammad Kaif: Clinical victory by @BLRTweets , they looked completely in control from the moment they won the toss! Congratulations #IPL2015

Starc: "I wouldn't say 100%, but I am feeling good. I am really happy to be playing for BLR. There is no bowler in the world who is 100%. I don't know, trade secrets (bowling the yorkers at the death). I leaked a few runs at the start, I try to swing the new ball. These are different conditions, but I am bowling well, so I don't need to change too much with my bowling."
Starc is the Man of the Match for his bowling figures of 4-0-22-3

Kohli: "We wanted that sort of a performance. This might be a momentum change for us. It was a timely win for us. I had to (asked if he had a talk with the team) and told the guys to visualise who you are playing against. The boys responded beautifully. We know we are a team that can play like that, it was the difference today. The intensity was top notch and one that any captain can be proud of. I didn't want to let things go like they were, but it's all about believing that you can go out there and win. Definitely we (himself, Gayle and ABD) are the ones that are batting mainly for BLR. ABD has to come in at No.3, he is the best batsman in the world and was a pleasure batting with him today."

Watson: "We had a really good crack out there (talking about the bowling). We were short on runs. Bangalore were superb today. They outplayed us in all departments. Virat (Kohli) and ABD then finished the game off. 160-170 was a minimum on this wicket. There is no excuse to losing a game. As long as we learn from it and perform better in the next game. We just need to turn this momentum around. We should make sure we get more things right next game."

Earlier in the day, it was Yuzvendra Chahal, who landed decisive blows with his leg-spin. Mitchell Starc followed it up by bowling with unrelenting control in the slog overs and picked up three scalps. Their fielding too was sharp, with Dinesh Karthik taking a splendid catch to send James Faulkner back to the pavilion. The BLR camp would be relieved to get back to winning ways.

BLR's batsmen backed up their bowlers by putting up a fine performance as the visitors registered a facile win. It was Virat Kohli, who unfurled a series of crunching shots. Kohli's knock can be encapsulated by how he advanced down the track to smack Shane Watson for a six in the 14th over. AB de Villiers too played an enterprising knock and gave Kohli valuable support. He targeted the main spinner in the opposition, Pravin Tambe, and collected two boundaries in the 9th over.

Both BLR batsmen congratulate each other. Kohli is pumped up with the win. RAJ players shake hands with the batsmen and then walk off the field. The BLR players shake hands with their counterparts as well as the two not-out batsmen.

16.1   Deepak Hooda to de Villiers, FOUR, BLR win! Their second of the season. RAJ slip to their second consecutive defeat. It was a juicy full toss from round the wicket, de Villiers had to put it in the gap, he did it with ease through mid-wicket
Deepak Hooda, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
15.6   D Kulkarni to de Villiers, 1 run, AB shimmies down the track, yorks himself but manages to dig it out to long-on
15.5   D Kulkarni to de Villiers, no run, full delivery around off, de Villiers mistimes the drive back to the bowler
15.4   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, Kulkarni fires a low full toss outside off, Kohli backs away as he advances, reaches out and drives square of the wicket, for a single
15.3   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 2 runs, Kohli gives the charge, Kulkarni digs it in halfway down the pitch, Kohli pulls it in front of square for a couple. BLR one hit away from winning the game
15.2   D Kulkarni to de Villiers, 1 run, good length ball on the stumps, de Villiers shuffles across and knocks it to long-on
15.1   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, banged in short, without much venom, Kohli hammers the pull straight to deep square leg
Dhawal Kulkarni [3.0-0-20-0] is back into the attack
14.6   Tambe to Kohli, 1 run, another quicker one around off, Kohli goes hard on the drive, the inside edge rolls to the on-side and the batsmen pick a quick single
14.5   Tambe to Kohli, no run, flatter and on the stumps, Kohli mistimes the punch back down the wicket
14.4   Tambe to de Villiers, 1 run, fired full and outside off, de Villiers drives it to sweeper cover
14.3   Tambe to Kohli, 1 run, Tambe overcompensates and bowls a half tracker, Kohli pulls it to deep mid-wicket
14.2   Tambe to Kohli, SIX, smoked! Flighted delivery on the stumps, Kohli dances down the wicket, gets to the pitch of the ball and sends it sailing into the crowd at long-on. That was a superb shot
14.1   Tambe to de Villiers, 1 run, nice floaty delivery, de Villiers drives to cover, Watson misfields and allows the run to be taken
Pravin Tambe [3.0-0-26-0] is back into the attack
Time-out
13.6   Watson to de Villiers, 1 run, pitched up outside off, de Villiers opens the bat face and drives square of the wicket on the off-side

13.5   Watson to de Villiers, FOUR, smashed! ABD skips down the wicket, converts this into a full length delivery and drills it straight down the ground, bisecting the two fielders at long-on and long-off to perfection
13.4   Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs, banged in halfway down the wicket, no real pace on that, de Villiers rocks back and pulls it in front of square, long-on tidies up

13.3   Watson to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli brings up his second fifty this season. He points his bat towards the dugout and pumps his fists. ABD walks up to him and congratulates him. Coming to the ball, slower delivery on off, Kohli nudges it wide of mid-wicket to get to the landmark

13.2   Watson to Kohli, 2 runs, again the duo showing their athleticism. Back of a length delivery, Kohli works it with soft hands in front of square on the leg-side, the call was for two and they get it with ease

13.1   Watson to Kohli, SIX, fantastic shot! That is a tremendous hit from the BLR skipper. Watson saw the batsman advance and pulled the length back, Kohli managed to get under it and smacked it straight down the ground for a maximum
Shane Watson [2.0-0-7-1] is back into the attack
12.6   Faulkner to Kohli, 1 run, Faulkner drifts onto Kohli's pads, he leans forward and clips it to deep square leg
12.5   Faulkner to Kohli, no run, fullish and outside off, Kohli drives and picks out cover
12.4   Faulkner to Kohli, no run, full delivery on the stumps, Kohli works it to mid-wicket, Nair fumbles but the duo don't risk a run
12.3   Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run, slower delivery from Faulkner, de Villiers walks across, is deceived by that and checks the shot, single taken to mid-off
12.2   Faulkner to Kohli, 1 run, angled across the right-hander, Kohli uses that and steers it to third man

12.1   Faulkner to Kohli, 2 runs, once again these two steal a second, on a length close to off, Kohli goes hard on the drive, the ball squirts off the inside edge to the right of mid-wicket, put pressure on the fielder and come back for the second
James Faulkner [1.0-0-12-0] is back into the attack
11.6   Tambe to Kohli, 1 run, flighted delivery just outside off, Kohli drives it to long-off and retains strike
11.5   Tambe to Kohli, 2 runs, bit more air on this delivery, Kohli comes down the track and lofts it to the left of long-on, Kulkarni runs across and keeps it to a couple
11.4   Tambe to Kohli, no run, pushed through outside off, Kohli slashes and the outside edge travels quickly to short third man
11.3   Tambe to Kohli, no run, trifle short and outside off, Kohli cuts and finds Nair at backward point
11.2   Tambe to de Villiers, 1 run, flatter and around off, de Villiers backs away slightly and punches to deep extra cover
11.1   Tambe to Kohli, 1 run, quicker, fuller and on the stumps, Kohli whips it along the ground to long-on
Pravin Tambe [2.0-0-21-0] is back into the attack
10.6   C Morris to Kohli, 1 run, another single easily taken, Morris keeps it back of a length, Kohli runs it off the face to third man
10.5   C Morris to de Villiers, 1 run, back of a length around off, de Villiers steers it with an open bat face to third man

10.4   C Morris to Kohli, 1 run, direct-hit and ABD would have been in trouble. The slower delivery, leg-cutter from Morris, Kohli dabs it to the right of the keeper, Samson moves across quickly and fires a throw at the striker's end, ABD was well short of the crease
10.3   C Morris to Kohli, no run, full delivery, almost a yorker, Kohli squeezes it to Smith at mid-off
10.2   C Morris to de Villiers, 1 run, dugs in short and on leg-stump, de Villiers helps it down to fine leg
10.1   C Morris to Kohli, 1 run, good length ball just outside off, Kohli drives it on the up to mid-off, sets off immediately for the single
Chris Morris [2.0-0-18-0] is back into the attack
9.6   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli jumps out of the crease, Kulkarni follows him with a full delivery, eased down to long-on
9.5   D Kulkarni to de Villiers, 1 run, off-cutter that angles in, de Villiers nudges it wide of mid-wicket

9.4   D Kulkarni to de Villiers, 2 runs, again, Kulkarni doesn't pitch the ball up, offers width outside off, de Villiers slaps it to deep extra cover, Hooda runs to his right and keeps the batsmen to a brace
9.3   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, banged in midway down the wicket, Kohli swivels and pulls it to fine leg
9.2   D Kulkarni to de Villiers, 1 run, short of length just outside off, dabbed down to third man with an angled bat
9.1   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Kohli shuffles across a touch and flicks it to deep square leg
Dhawal Kulkarni [2.0-0-13-0] is back into the attack
Time for the strategic break
8.6   Tambe to de Villiers, no run, slower and wider outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover
8.5   Tambe to de Villiers, FOUR, Tambe pushes this one flatter and on AB's pads, he goes back and tucks it very fine, another boundary. BLR are running away with the match
8.4   Tambe to Kohli, 1 run, flighted delivery and just outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single
8.3   Tambe to de Villiers, 1 run, slower and spinning away from outside off, AB comes down the track and works it square past point for a single
8.2   Tambe to de Villiers, FOUR, Tambe dragged this one way too short and on the stumps, AB rocked back and pulled it powerfully past mid-wicket, no need to run for those
8.1   Tambe to de Villiers, no run, tossed up wider outside off, slapped straight to the fielder at extra cover
7.6   Watson to de Villiers, 1 run, fuller length delivery and on the stumps, AB presents the full face of the bat and punches it down towards long-on
7.5   Watson to de Villiers, no run, short of a length and on the stumps, flicked away straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
7.4   Watson to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Kohli was looking to pull, changes his mind and dabs it down towards third man
7.3   Watson to Kohli, 2 runs, back of a length and on Kohli's hips, tucked away behind square on the on-side. Kohli puts the pressure on Tambe who fumbles and allows an extra run
7.2   Watson to de Villiers, 1 run, fuller length delivery and on the stumps, eased down towards long-on for a single
7.1   Watson to Kohli, 1 run, short of a length and well outside off, Kohli crashes it square on the off-side for a single, he took a step forward there
Shane Watson [1.0-0-1-1] is back into the attack
6.6   Tambe to de Villiers, no run, the drifter from Tambe, AB presses forward and blocks
6.5   Tambe to Kohli, 1 run, pushed through by Tambe, tucked away past mid-wicket for a single
6.4   Tambe to Kohli, 2 runs, tossed up and on Kohli's pads, nudged away in front of square on the on-side. Kohli runs hard and gets back for the second run
6.3   Tambe to Kohli, SIX, that's easy pickings for Kohli, Tambe dropped this one short and on the stumps, Kohli rocks back and pulls it high and over wide mid-wicket for a maximum
6.2   Tambe to de Villiers, 1 run, flighted delivery and well outside off, eased past cover for a single
6.1   Tambe to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up and on the stumps, Kohli goes back and punches it down towards long-on for a single
Pravin Tambe, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
5.6   Faulkner to Kohli, 1 run, this is excellent running from the two batsmen, now AB called Kohli through for a quick single after the batsman dabbed one towards Rahane at backward point
5.5   Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run, the slower leg-cutter from Faulkner, AB dabs it towards short third man, Kohli calls him through for a quick single and beats the throw from the fielder
5.4   Faulkner to de Villiers, FOUR, no need to run for these, width on offer from Faulkner, AB was back in his crease and cracks it crisply through extra cover for a boundary
5.3   Faulkner to de Villiers, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, AB takes a walk down the track and drives it towards mid-off
5.2   Faulkner to de Villiers, FOUR, cracking shot, short of a length and well outside off, AB waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and laces it past point for a boundary
5.1   Faulkner to de Villiers, 2 runs, length ball and on AB's pads, tucked away behind square on the on-side. AB is super quick and gets back for the second run
James Faulkner, comes into the attack
4.6   Watson to de Villiers, 1 run, another slower ball from Watson, driven to the left of mid-off where Smith makes a tumbling stop
4.5   Watson to de Villiers, no run, short of a length and just outside off, AB looks to chop it towards the off-side and gets a bottom edge onto the pads
4.4   Watson to de Villiers, no run, short of a length and on AB's hips, tucked away straight to short fine
AB de Villiers, right handed bat, comes to the crease
AB gets a promotion, the right move, according to me

4.3   Watson to Gayle, out Caught by Samson!! That's a soft dismissal for Gayle! This was the slower bouncer from Watson, Gayle got into an almighty tangle as he looked to dab it towards the on-side, gets a top-edge and the ball loops through to the keeper. RAJ needed this wicket, Gayle was threatening to take the match away from them. Gayle c Samson b Watson 20(17) [4s-3 6s-1]
Watson to Gayle, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
4.2   Watson to Gayle, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, punched towards mid-off
4.1   Watson to Gayle, no run, on a good length and slanting across Gayle, dabbed away towards backward point
Shane Watson, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

3.6   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 2 runs, short of a length and just outside off, Kohli plays with an angled bat and runs it very fine. Morris gets across from third man, slides and pulls the ball back in, just a brace for Kohli
3.5   D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, that's all too easy for Kohli, fraction short and just outside off, Kohli is quick to swivel across and pulls it over mid-wicket for another boundary
3.4   D Kulkarni to Kohli, no run, Kulkarni shortened the length as Kohli gave the charge, he adjusts and defends it towards cover
3.3   D Kulkarni to Gayle, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, punched down towards long-on for a single
3.2   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Kohli plays with an angled bat and runs it down towards third man
3.1   D Kulkarni to Kohli, no run, short of a length and just outside off, defended with an open face towards backward point

2.6   C Morris to Gayle, SIX, smashed, length ball from Morris, Gayle clears his left leg and sends this one sailing over the long-on fence. 15 runs from the over, the big man has woken up from his slumber
Back over the wicket
2.5   C Morris to Gayle, FOUR, you can't bowl there to Gayle, fraction fuller and just outside off, Gayle stays back and hammers it over extra cover, no need to run for those
Morris changes to round the wicket
2.4   C Morris to Gayle, no run, high full toss from Morris, Gayle is taken by surprise and pushes it towards mid-on
2.3   C Morris to Gayle, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Morris, Gayle stands tall and flashes it square past cover, no need to run for those
2.2   C Morris to Gayle, no run, tad fuller and angling across the left-hander, Gayle is slightly opened up as he defends it towards point
2.1   C Morris to Kohli, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, dabbed away towards third man for a single
1.6   D Kulkarni to Gayle, no run, short of a length and well outside off, Gayle cracks it straight to the fielder at cover-point
1.5   D Kulkarni to Gayle, no run, on a good length and just outside off, driven firmly but straight to the fielder at mid-on

1.4   D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, that's the Gayle that has been adored all through the previous seasons of IPL, back of a length and just outside off, Gayle stands tall and flat-bats it over mid-off, no need to run for those
1.3   D Kulkarni to Gayle, leg byes, FOUR, wrong line from Kulkarni, short and on Gayle's pads, he looks to flick and misses, the ball rolls away past the keeper and into the fence
1.2   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, cramps Kohli for room as he looked to cut, gets an inside edge towards square leg, off strike with a single
1.1   D Kulkarni to Kohli, no run, short of a length and on Kohli's hips, tucked away towards mid-wicket
Dhawal Kulkarni, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
0.6   C Morris to Kohli, 1 run, another false shot, this time by Kohli, closed the face of the bat to this inswinger, gets a thick leading edge that rolls past cover, just a single

0.5   C Morris to Gayle, 1 run, that's a cracking yorker from Morris full and shaping back into Gayle, he gets his right leg out of the firing line and just about jams it past mid-wicket for a single. He's smiling, Gayle, wouldn't have if he was cleaned up there
0.4   C Morris to Gayle, no run, that's a teasing line from Morris, pitches it up and in that corridor outside off, lures Gayle forward on the drive and beats his outside edge
0.3   C Morris to Kohli, 1 run, fuller length delivery and well outside off, driven away through extra cover for a single
0.2   C Morris to Gayle, leg byes, 1 run, too straight from Morris, ends up drifting onto Gayle's pads, he looks to tuck it behind square and misses, sneaks in a leg-bye
0.1   C Morris to Gayle, no run, short of a length and in that channel outside off, nips back in slighty, Gayle was on the back foot as he defends it
Gayle and Kohli are at the crease. Gayle is on strike. C Morris will open the attack

Welcome back.. BLR's best ever effort with the ball for this season has seen them restrict RAJ to a meagre 130. Can their batsmen complete the chase? New opening combination for BLR. Kohli is walking out to the middle with Gayle. Two slips in place as Morris steams in..

Chahal: "I am flighting the ball and varying my pace. Dan (Vettori) and Virat (Kohli) have told me to toss the ball. I basically bowl the leg-spinner, but now and then slip in the googly. You have to assess the conditions and then bowl accordingly. Surely (when asked if they will win today)."

It was Steven Smith, who played with a calm head on his shoulders to compose a fine knock. However, he couldn't pilot them to a good total as he was dismissed by Mitchell Starc. In fact, Starc bowled well in the slog overs and scalped three wickets. The track is helping the spinners a bit. But BLR's batsmen should back themselves to overhaul the home team's score.

BLR's spinners led by Yuzvendra Chahal put up a disciplined effort to restrict the hosts to a below par total. In particular, Chahal with his flight and guile made an impact and snared a couple of wickets. Iqbal Abdulla too showed his worth by winkling out the dangerous Deepak Hooda.

Kohli has his boys in a huddle as soon as the innings was completed. Something we have not seen before in the tournament. It has been a superb effort with the ball and now upto the batsmen to take them home.
19.6   Starc to Tambe, 1 run, length delivery on the stumps, Tambe gets behind the line and works it to the on-side. A brilliant last over from the No.1 ODI bowler

19.5   Starc to Tambe, no run, how did that miss the stumps? Starc has his hands on his head. On a length around off, Tambe makes room and fails to connect with the drive, the ball almost shaved the off-pole
19.4   Starc to C Morris, 1 run, full toss on the stumps, Morris advances and toe-ends the drive to mid-off, only a single on offer
19.3   Starc to Tambe, 1 run, low full toss just outside off, Tambe guides it to the right of backward point and hands the strike back to Morris
19.2   Starc to Tambe, no run, fullish and outside off, Tambe drives and is beaten by the pace. This is too good for the veteran
Pravin Tambe, right handed bat, comes to the crease

19.1   Starc to D Kulkarni, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! That is a Starc special. Not much Kulkarni could do with that. Starc round the wicket and fires in the yorker, Kulkarni stays leg-side of the ball and fails to squeeze it out, the off-stump is uprooted. RAJ on the verge of being bowled out. That delivery was bowled at 143.3kph. D Kulkarni b Starc 1(2)
Starc to D Kulkarni, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!
18.6   Harshal Patel to D Kulkarni, 1 run, another off-speed to end the over, Kulkarni is early into the shot, chips it to cover-point and retains strike
Dhawal Kulkarni, right handed bat, comes to the crease

18.5   Harshal Patel to Faulkner, out Caught by D Karthik!! A stunner from DK. Faulkner can't believe that he has been dismissed. The umpires are going upstairs, but Faulkner is walking back. Looks like they wanted to check for the catch, it is and the batsman has to go. The slower ball from Patel, Faulkner walked across the stumps, scoops it to the left of the keeper, Karthik dives full length and grabs it with one-hand. He anticipated that early which made it easier for him to go for the catch. Faulkner c D Karthik b Harshal Patel 4(5)
Harshal Patel to Faulkner, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
18.4   Harshal Patel to C Morris, 1 run, full and just short of yorker length, Morris drags it off the inside part to deep mid-wicket
18.3   Harshal Patel to Faulkner, 1 run, slower short ball, Faulkner had to wait for the ball to arrive and pull it to backward square leg
18.2   Harshal Patel to C Morris, 1 run, length delivery around off, Morris swings hard and drags it to long-on
18.1   Harshal Patel to Faulkner, 1 run, low full toss just outside off, Faulkner drives it to mid-off and takes a quick single
Harshal Patel [3.0-0-18-1] is back into the attack
17.6   Starc to Faulkner, 1 run, goes back over the wicket, bowls it on the pads, Faulkner flicks and picks out the fielder at backward square leg
Chris Morris, right handed bat, comes to the crease

17.5   Starc to Binny, out Caught by Wiese!! Starc gets another. Second of the over. RAJ losing their way here. Binny could not capitalize on the drop chance. Full and outside off, Binny clears his front leg and slices it off the outer half to sweeper cover, Wiese didn't have to move much to take that. Binny is not pleased, he punches his bat in anger. Binny c Wiese b Starc 20(20) [4s-2]
Starc to Binny, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Starc goes round the wicket
17.4   Starc to Faulkner, 1 run, back of a length around off, Faulkner dabs it to point and sets off immediately, for a single
17.3   Starc to Binny, 1 run, full and on the stumps, Binny closes the bat face a bit too early, the outside edge rolls down to third man
17.2   Starc to Binny, no run, slanted across off, Binny swings hard and connects with thin air
James Faulkner, right handed bat, comes to the crease

17.1   Starc to S Smith, out Caught by D Karthik!! Starc strikes with the first ball in his second spell. He has given BLR the huge breakthrough as Smith would have been dangerous at this stage of the innings. Full and angled across the right-hander, Smith shuffles across and wanted to go big over long-off, gets a thickish outside edge to the right of the keeper, DK calls for it and takes a simple catch. Smith is not happy with himself. S Smith c D Karthik b Starc 31(28) [4s-2]
Starc to S Smith, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Mitchell Starc [2.0-0-16-0] is back into the attack

16.6   Chahal to Binny, 2 runs, Binny is chancing his luck. Tries to go inside out to the flighted delivery, skips out of the crease, doesn't get to the pitch but still goes through with the shot, the ball balloons over extra cover, who was running back. The batsmen scamper back for the second
16.5   Chahal to S Smith, 1 run, Chahal slips in the googly as Smith comes down the track, the Australian guides it to cover-point, for a single
16.4   Chahal to Binny, 1 run, second time in the over Binny goes for the reverse sweep, this time he picks out Gayle at short third man
16.3   Chahal to S Smith, 1 run, goes straight on after pitching, Smith dabs it to short third man and rotates the strike
16.2   Chahal to Binny, 1 run, sees the batsman advance and drags the length back, Binny slaps it to deep extra cover

16.1   Chahal to Binny, FOUR, superb shot! A flighted delivery on off, Binny reverse sweeps it over short third man, though he didn't middle it, he managed to clear the fielder. That was a pre-meditated shot from Binny
Yuzvendra Chahal [2.1-0-15-2] is back into the attack

15.6   Wiese to S Smith, FOUR, once more BLR leak a boundary off the last ball of the over. The off-cutter just outside off, Smith moves across his stumps and pulls it behind square, he beats the man in the deep quite comfortably
15.5   Wiese to Binny, 1 run, Binny backs away to the leg-side, Wiese follows him with a short delivery, Binny manages to flat-bat it to long-off
15.4   Wiese to S Smith, 1 run, again, the length is short, Smith cracks it to sweeper cover, picks out the fielder there
15.3   Wiese to S Smith, no run, shortish and outside off, Smith plays the cut and fails to make contact
15.2   Wiese to Binny, 1 run, slower delivery which is short in length, Binny heaves it to deep mid-wicket, on the bounce to the fielder

15.1   Wiese to Binny, 2 runs, dropped! That was a sitter. A back of a length delivery on off, Binny walks down the wicket and lofts it on the up to long-on, he got it off the toe-end and didn't get the timing right, Abdulla steadied himself under it and spilled it. The entire BLR dugout was amassed by that effort

14.5   Harshal Patel to Binny, FOUR, cheeky! RAJ needed this boundary as the runs had dried up. It was a back of a length delivery on off, Binny waited for the ball to arrive, opened the bat face and ran it down to the third man fence

14.1   Harshal Patel to Binny, 1 run, excellent start to the over, inswinging yorker, it was heading straight to the stumps, Binny somehow manages to bring his bat down and jam it to the on-side

BLR have their noses in front now. Samson b Chahal 4(7)

Chahal is back on the field. So, that is good news for BLR.

Harshal fires a superb flat return, Kohli picks up the ball and flicks it onto the stumps. Nair was always struggling. RAJ have lost their third wicket. Nair run out (Harshal Patel/Kohli) 16(14) [6s-1]

Looks like Chahal has hurt himself as well. It's the little finger on his right hand, the physio is out for some treatment. Not sure what's going on here, Erasmus has a word or two with Kohli. Chahal is walking off, Kohli will complete the over. If Chahal can't bowl anymore, that will be a huge blow to BLR

Watson can't believe it, he stares across towards his partner and walks off. Kohli is pumped up as he hugs his young bowler. Watson c Starc b Chahal 26(22) [4s-4 6s-1]

0.3   Starc to Watson, wide, Starc hasn't got his radar right here, he swings this one down leg-side once again, called as a wide
0.2   Starc to Rahane, 1 run, fuller length delivery and a hint of shape back into Rahane, he covers the line and drives it to the right of mid-off for a single

Rahane and Watson are at the crease. Rahane is on strike. Starc will open the attack
Starc to start for BLR. He has a slip in place..
It's time for action. The two umpires are out in the middle. An animated Virat Kohli is in the midst of an inspiring team huddle. The two Rajasthan openers are out in the middle as well.
Teams:
Bangalore (Playing XI): Chris Gayle, Mandeep Singh, Virat Kohli(c), Dinesh Karthik(w), AB de Villiers, Sarfaraz Khan, David Wiese, Harshal Patel, Mitchell Starc, Iqbal Abdulla, Yuzvendra Chahal
Rajasthan (Playing XI): Ajinkya Rahane, Shane Watson(c), Steven Smith, Sanju Samson(w), Karun Nair, Deepak Hooda, Stuart Binny, James Faulkner, Chris Morris,Dhawal Kulkarni, Pravin Tambe

Watson: 'We have got a really good squad, have built on the squad from the last season. We had a tough game against Punjab, but have learnt our lessons. BLR have some world class players, but we will play to our strengths. The noise here is incredible, the crowd has been very special. It's going to be a good challenge, playing against these guys. We have got a long batting line-up. Just one change, Dhawal Kulkarni in place of Rahul Tewatia.'

Kohli: 'We have got good support here, it's a crowd that loves cricket overall. We have played only 4 matches, but we need to turn things pretty soon. Need to get that complete performance. I expect guys to step up themselves and be honest in the changing room, everyone has to give their 100%. We will bowl first, looks like the wicket will stay similar. They are playing a spinner short, dew might come in later as well. We are trying to figure out our best combination. Chris Gayle is playing, Mandeep comes in place of Bisla.'
Bangalore have won the toss and have opted to field
Team News: Chris Gayle is having a net session in the middle. Does it mean he's in the playing XI today? If so, will he replace Rilee Rossouw or David Wiese?
Weather Report: Ahmedabad was baking hot at 43 degrees in the morning and it's expected to be a clear evening. The humdity is just 19% and that should make the players feel a lot more comfortable.

Head-to-Head: Rajasthan hold the edge over Bangalore with a 7-6 scoreline. Can Bangalore bounce back from three successive losses and level the scores? Or will the Rajasthan get back to winning ways? We'll find out soon as the toss is round the corner.

Chris Gayle opted out of the last game, so that he can be fit for the entire tournament. He was the key when they beat the Kolkata. So, the Challengers would want him back and firing. ABD has once again looked the best batsman for them, even though Virat Kohli scored a fifty in the previous match, it was not a typical Virat innings. The bowling has struggled as there have been too many chop and change in the attack. Mitchell Starc returned to lead the attack, but was not able to provide the early breakthrough. They would want others to support him, if they have to keep the opposition in check.

Bangalore started their campaign with a win over defending champions Kolkata, but since then things have gone downward. They played three games at home and lost all of them. The last being against familiar foes, Chennai. Raina and Faf du Plessis powered Chennai to massive score of 181. Ashish Nehra then struck in regular intervals and finished with a 4-wicket haul. In the end, Bangalore lost by 27 runs.

The Rajasthan look like a well balanced side. Rahane and Smith have been firing with the bat, the former also is the owner of the Orange Cap. Watson returned after a slight niggle and has looked in fine touch as well. Morris, Tambe and Faulkner have been the core of the bowling attack. They have managed to strangle the opposition during crunch situations. Deepak Hooda has also played a vital role in the team, with both bat and ball.

Rajasthan had won 5 on the trot before Punjab handed them their first defeat, thanks to a Super Over finish. The Rajasthan were set to win their 6 game of the season, but Shaun Marsh and David Miller had other plans. Both batsmen scored blistering fifties and then Axar Patel and Mitchell Johnson tied the game. In the Super Over, Marsh again belted Morris around and set them a target of 16, Johnson then cleaned up Watson and Saha's brilliance saw Faulkner short of the ground.

18:45 Local Time, 13:15 GMT, 18:45 IST: Battle of two contrasting teams, Rajasthan vs Bangalore. One sit pretty on top of the table while the other languish in 7th place, just above Mumbai. Though both have lost their previous games, the Rajasthan seem to be the in-form team. Beating them in their adopted home is not going to be easy.

Preview:
There are many ways to look at the Pepsi Indian Premier League 2015 fixture featuring Rajasthan and Bangalore. To say that one of these teams has been impressive will be an understatement, while the other one is yet to show any signs of encouragement. One side is leading the table whereas the other one is languishing at the bottom. One has continued to win hearts with gritty cricket while the other has seen its big guns misfiring in crunch situations. In all fairness, Rajasthan have been the one to take away all the compliments, while Bangalore have been nowhere near it.

Punjab pushed the Rajasthan to the edge, but it could have been anybody's game. A sixth win was within reach had a forgotten Shaun Marsh not returned to the fold and set it alright for both him and his team, causing Rajasthan to finally experience a lapse after five matches of sheer brilliance. However, all that fails in comparison to how their campaign has been in this year's IPL. They've been the team to watch out for, and will be eyeing a sixth when they face BLR at 'home'.

A batting-heavy BLR unit has failed to deliver so far. Barring their win over defending champions Kolkata, it's been a forgettable three matches for them, so much that they had to drop Chris Gayle out of the playing XI. Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers have shown glimpses of form, but they have not been able to see the side through to the finish- something they will be eager to do if they are to progress up the ladder.

Venue: Sardar Patel Stadium, Motera, Ahmedabad

Date and Time: April 24, 2015, 20:00 IST

Weather: Clear sky with the temperature touching 30 degree Celsius

Team News:

Rajasthan

Shane Watson's addition has sorted the opening combination for the Rajasthan and Deepak Hooda batting up the order in place of the struggling Sanju Samson turned out to be a good move against PUN. However, the Rajasthan may be tempted to bring back Dhawal Kulkarni in their attack. Kulkarni was oddly left out after his miserly figures of 2 for 9 against the Hyderabad and going by their policy of rotating the bowlers, it might be the ideal occasion to bring back the nippy medium-pacer in place of Rahul Tewatia.

Probable XI: 1 Ajinkya Rahane, 2 Shane Watson (capt), 3 Steven Smith, 4 Deepak Hooda, 5 Karun Nair, 6 Stuart Binny, 7 Sanju Samson (wk), 8 James Faulkner, 9 Pravin Tambe, 10 Dhawal Kulknarni, 11 Chris Morris

Bangalore

There is a feeling that Starc's inclusion may have led to Gayle sitting out the game against Chennai, but you simply can't bench the Jamaican in a format like this, especially when he's had so much success for BLR. Gayle coming back should be a no-brainer unless he's nursing an injury. The gamble is Kohli's to take - whether to play David Wiese, who took 4 for 33 against Mumbai and 1 for 46 against CHN or Rossouw, with scores of 14 and 0. It is likely that BLR will go in with Wiese in order to boost their bowling, something that has been a cause of concern for them.

Probable XI: 1 Chris Gayle, 2 Manvinder Bisla, 3 Virat Kohli (capt), 4 Dinesh Karthik (wk), 5 AB de Villiers, 6 Sarfraz Khan, 7 David Wiese, 8 Harshal Patel, 9 Mitchell Starc, 10 Iqbal Abdulla, 11 Yuzvendra Chahal

Stats:

Ajinkya Rahane, with 305 runs, is the leading run-scorer in IPL 2015, while Yuzvendra Chahal has taken the maximum wickets for BLR - 8.

Quotes:

Vettori sir had told me beforehand that I will be bowling with the new ball. It was our plan to stifle McCullum with spin early on. I was just trying to bowl accurately with a few subtle variations. I happened to bowl a slow wrong-un and it got me McCullum's wicket - Chahal on his learning from BLR coach Daniel Vettori.

The way we are backing players and playing our cricket is good. In T20, an odd result doesn't go your way; it is important that as team, weplay all the 40 overs with 100 percent commitment - Rahane is not reading too much into the Rajasthan' loss to Punjab.
Teams:

Bangalore (From): Chris Gayle, Manvinder Bisla, Virat Kohli(c), Dinesh Karthik(w), AB de Villiers, Sarfaraz Khan, David Wiese, Mitchell Starc, Iqbal Abdulla, Harshal Patel, Yuzvendra Chahal, Rilee Rossouw, Nic Maddinson, Varun Aaron, Ashok Dinda, Vijay Zol, Abu Nechim, Sandeep Warrier, Yogesh Takawale, Mandeep Singh, S Badrinath, Darren Sammy, Sean Abbott, Sreenath Aravind, Jalaj Saxena, Shishir Bhavane

Rajasthan (From): Shane Watson(c), Ajinkya Rahane, Steven Smith, Sanju Samson(w), Karun Nair, Deepak Hooda, Stuart Binny, James Faulkner, Chris Morris, Pravin Tambe, Rahul Tewatia, Rajat Bhatia, Tim Southee, Dhawal Kulkarni, Abhishek Nayar, Ben Cutting, Dishant Yagnik, Vikramjeet Malik, Ankit Sharma, Dinesh Salunkhe, RustyTheron, Pardeep Sahu, Brainder Sran, Sagar Trivedi
